headline.main: Jean Mayer, 72, Nutritionist Who Led Tufts, Dies

docs.lead_paragraph: Dr. Jean Mayer, the Chancellor and former president of Tufts University whose work as a nutritionist helped clarify the nature of hunger and obesity and expanded the Federal food stamp and school lunch programs, died yesterday in Sarasota, Fla., where he was vacationing. He was 72 and lived in Boston. Dr. Mayer, who was elevated to Chancellor on Sept. 1 after 16 years as the university's president, died of a heart attack, said Gail Bambrick, associate director of communications for Tufts, in Medford, Mass.
